item.title: Proving the Central Limit Theorem using R
item.description: What is the central limit theorem? Perhaps the most important concept in statistical inference. It gives us two primary insights: If a variable is normally distributed, the sampling distribution of a test statistic calculated from this variable will also be normally distributed. If a variableâ€™s distribution is non-normal or unknown, the sampling distribution of its test statistics approach normality as sample size increases.
